channel.title: Pages on Penrose Library, Whitman College, Walla Walla, WA
channel.description: Recent content in Pages on Penrose Library, Whitman College, Walla Walla, WA

item.title: Accessibility Information
item.description: Library Accessibility Statement We strive to support all patrons in accessing library materials and services. If you have any questions or concerns, please contact the library.

item.title: Library Services & FAQ
item.description: Search Library FAQ If you are looking for a specific title please search in [Sherlock](sherlock.whitman.edu) I have a question about… Accessibility of Library Resources Archives & Special Collections Articles Books Circulation / Borrowing items Citations Copyright Guidance Computers & Printing Using Databases Faculty Services General Information Interlibrary Loans (Borrow items from other libraries) Research Sherlock (Library Catalog) Student Employment Tabling Frequently Used Forms General Library Materials Gift Form Honors Thesis related Forms Recording Consent & Copyright Release Form Long-Term Locker Form Special Collections Materials Gift Form Suggest a Purchase Form Library Policies About the Library Penrose Library: An Educational Partner Penrose Mission and Values Statement Library Use Policy Exhibits Policy Gifts to Penrose Library Library Accessibility Statement Library Newsletter Location and Directions

item.title: Top 10 Things for Staff to Know about Penrose Library
item.description: 1. Important Links Library homepage and catalog (http://library.whitman.edu) Phone number 509-527-5192 Staff directory (https://library.whitman.edu/contact_librarystaff/) Library FAQ (https://library.whitman.edu/library_services/) 2. Penrose Library Hours Library hours can be found on our website and reflect our most up-to-date information.

item.title: DEIA Actions
item.description: Penrose Library supports Whitman College’s efforts towards Diversity, Equity and Inclusion and we have drafted our own statement affirming this. These examples are ways we as a library have begun to create more inclusive and responsive library services and spaces.

item.title: E-Books for Displays
item.description: Disability Pride Month (July 2024) The Architecture of Disability : Buildings, Cities, and Landscapes Beyond Access Being Heumann : an unrepentant memoir of a disability rights activist

item.title: About the Library
item.description: Penrose Library: An Educational Partner Penrose Library fosters the intellectual engagement and scholarly practice of the Whitman community. We curate and provide access to diverse and unique collections, and teach the skills and concepts needed to navigate complex information environments at Whitman and beyond.

item.title: Explore our Collections
item.description: Collection Areas Northwest Manuscripts Collection WCNA acknowledges that we exist upon the traditional homeland of the Cayuse, Umatilla, Walla Walla and Nez Perce Peoples. WCNA collects and solicits donations of manuscripts and records from individuals and organizations of significance to the history and present of the Walla Walla region and the inland Pacific Northwest.
